item.title: [PI] adding coustom items help
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Ok, walk me through this, do I make a raw folder in my client side and put the .dat files there?

And the ints? are they what I posted in the original post of this thread?, if so how do I enter them?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] adding coustom items help
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

oh sorry, i didnt realise its PI.

Ok, so you want to go to the client, and add the ints to the ‘itemdef’. and look for a line named something like “start of item codes” or “Coded item start” etc…

then you want to go to the item.JAVA file on the server files and add the item IDs to the arrays they belong in. like chest plate. plate legs. etc

next you need to go to the item.cfg and add the new items to the bottom of the list along with the name. stats. cost. etc.

Repost if i left anything out, of u need help.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] adding coustom items help
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Ok, Ive looked up all I could to put custom items in my PI server and this is where I understood, I made a raw folder in my client folder, and I put the models there, now i know that PI has no class8.java and that it goes in itemdef.java but this doesn’t look right: if(i == 13665) // change this if you need to "item number" { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";//New option class8.anIntArray156 = new int[2]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[2]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 43072; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 925; class8.anIntArray156[1] = 4550; class8.anIntArray160[1] = 925; class8.anInt174 = 14104; //Model ID class8.anInt181 = 1330; //zoom increase will make it smaller class8.anInt190 = 310; //model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you class8.anInt198 = 1800; //model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle class8.anInt169 = 0; // model offset increase to move to the right class8.anInt194 = 1; //model offset increase to move up class8.anInt165 = 14105;//male wearing class8.anInt200 = 14105;//female wearing class8.anInt164 = 14106;//Female arms/sleeves class8.anInt188 = 14106;//male arms/sleeves class8.aBoolean176 = false;//Stackable class8.aString170 = "Dragon platebody";//Name of the new item class8.aByteArray178 = "Provides excellent protection".getBytes();//examin info }
Now, im pretty sure that doesn’t go in itemdef.java, what do I do?

Read full topic
